interviewer_dialogue: Hi.  This is uh.. Interviewer, the landlady.

patient_dialogue: Yes.  Well, uhm.. I was calling you b-- uh.. because uh.. I called you a few days back about the leak in my ceiling, and I would like to know uh.. when will you be able to come over to fix it?  The leak has now gotten much worse and is damaging uh.. proper--
interviewer_dialogue: Okay.  Uhm.. well, I don’t know what I can do about your problem right now.

patient_dialogue: Well, I really need to get it fixed because it’s really uhm.. damaging my furniture and it’s just damaging the property.  Like, the leak has gotten much bigger than it was a few days back when I called you the first time.
interviewer_dialogue: Okay.  I have a lot- a lot of other tenants with problems that are ahead of yours.

patient_dialogue: Well, I really need to uh.. find a solution for this because I cannot stay uh.. with a ceiling like that for much longer.  If anything, that’s gonna fall off. <laughs>
interviewer_dialogue: All right.  Uhm.. I do all the repairs myself for the whole building.

patient_dialogue: Uhm.. do you have anybody else that you think can come over?  Or maybe I can bring someone over to fix it and then we can discuss about the payment.
interviewer_dialogue: Uhm.. I’m sorry I haven’t had enough time to get over to fix it, but I’ve been very busy.

patient_dialogue: Yes, I understand, but like I said, it’s uhm.. it’s- it’s risking my children and just the apartment itself is just collapsing in the ceiling, and with the raining days, it’s just getting worse.
interviewer_dialogue: It didn’t sound that bad the last time you called.

patient_dialogue: Yes.  Like I said, it has gotten uh.. much worse these days, and that’s why I- I’m calling you, because I don’t want it to get any worse than what it is right now.
interviewer_dialogue: I have a list and you’re on the list, but there are other problems that are more serious.

patient_dialogue: Well, I think we need to come up with uh.. an agreement, because like I said, it’s gonna-- it stay like that much uh.. longer.  I think it’s pretty serious the fact I’m putting my childrens at risk.
interviewer_dialogue: It might take me about a week, maybe even two weeks before I’ll have time to fix it.

patient_dialogue: Wow.  I really need it to be fixed a little bit uh.. much faster.  You told me that you were gonna be coming the next day or- or two, and...
interviewer_dialogue: All right.  I’m aware of the problem and I’ll be over as soon as I can to fix it.

patient_dialogue: Well, uh.. how soon do you think that will be?
interviewer_dialogue: Uhm.. I could come over right now.
